page.title: 08M5 STRENSHAM AREA.
page.content: The{M5 Exeter to Birmingham motorway crosses the area diagonally from North to South. Its affect on the area has been considerably. Its has cut through the middle of farms, making access to the land difficult. People who work in such places as Birmingham and Bristol have moved into villages in the area, finding the journey to work quick and easy with the coming of the motorway. Pressure of lorry and holiday traffic has been taken off many villages and small towns. Much of the wild life was probably disturbed by the building of the motorway but kestrels can be seen hovering over the grass verges. Originally the motorway was two lanes only but it is progressively being widened to three lanes - a long term project. There is{one service station} in this section at Strensham.
